docs.title: Welcome to Axilock Documentation
docs.text: Axilock is a state of the art security solution designed to secure your tech stack from day one. It works as a companion that that keeps your codebase secure at every step of the way.

docs.title: Axilock Secret Prevention
docs.text: Prevents secrets from being committed to your codebase. Axilock takes a proactive approach to secret prevention and saves you time and effort, rather than a reactive approach to secret detection -- where harm is already done and a proccess needs to be triggered for secret rotation. You will always stay compliant by never pushing a secret in the first place.

docs.title: Axilock Redactor
docs.text: Redacts secrets from your codebase. If you have already commited a secret to your codebase, Axilock Redactor will help you remove it. It will also help you remove the secret from your git history and from any other files in your codebase.

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
Run the following command to install Axilock Secret Prevention:

curl https://get.axilock.ai | sh

Installation will require authentication with your Axilock account via your VCS (GitHub, GitLab, Bitbucket, etc.).

docs.title: Usage
docs.text: Once installed and logged in, axilock secret prevention will automatically scan your commits on every push to your repository. If any secrets are found, the push will be rejected and you will be notified.

docs.title: Bypass
docs.text:
In cases where you intentionally want to push a commit with a secret (for whatever reason) , you can use git's --no-verify flag to bypass the Axilock prevention check.

Warning

It is is not recommended to bypass secret prevention as it can lead to compromised credentials and security breaches.

Example:

git commit -m "Add secret" --no-verify
